item.title: Report E-2024090342
item.description:
Report E-2024090342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 55000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1350 ET, Jeremiah Faustinos with XPO terminal UPH notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that an estimated amount of 2-Gallons of UN3103 Organic Peroxide Type C released due to pressurizing during transit. The release impacted trailer #3233003. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to perform cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 50 gallons of product released to 15'x8.5' area of the trailer floor due to excessive heat. Contractors transferred product, empty jerricans, impacted absorbents to 3 drums, 4 totes and 10 CUYD's. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage. All liquid product was salvaged and transferred into poly jerricans and sent on to customer.

item.title: Report E-2024090337
item.description:
Report E-2024090337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:12 EST on 8/21, XPO-UPH contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 4 ounces of UN1993 "Unisol Liquid Red BK-50" from a 250-gallon metal tote impacting the trailer floor. The tote was discovered with a crack in the body at the bottom of the tote, which was likely damaged during loading at XCN. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleaning the spill and transferring the remaining liquid to a new tote. The salvage material and leaking tote was transferred into drums for salvage. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 4 ounces of product impacted the trailer floor due to faulty weld/seam on tote leg. Contractors then containerized to 1 55-gallon drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090327
item.description:
Report E-2024090327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1045 ET, XPO terminal UPH notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 7 ounces of Univar Solutions Butyl Acetates UN1123 released from (1)5-gallon metal pail due to metal bar inside of the trailer falling onto cargo. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and terminal personnel determined they would clean the release with PPE and absorbents available on site. The damaged pail and clean up debris were containerized into a 55-gallon drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090251
item.description:
Report E-2024090251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics driver domiciled out of UPH (Pheonix, AZ) contacted ERTS regarding the release of Benco Sanding Sealer. A Contractor was dispatched to the driver’s location and observed a 2-gallon release from one 5-gallon PAIL containing Benco Sanding Sealer. The release impacted the wooden trailer floor, the pallet, and the shrink-wrap in a 1’x1’ area. It was concluded that the release was caused by improper blocking and bracing and therefore load-shift during transit. The Contractor overpacked the leaking container along with the impacted debris and absorbents. The waste was taken to XPO-UPH to manage for end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
